==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Etymology===
The shape of the character {{zh-l|*瓜}} can be decomposed into two {{zh-l|*八|eight}}, thus “breaking {{lang|zh|瓜}}” is used to euphemistically refer to reaching the age of 8+8 (=16) for girls, and 8×8 (=64) for men.

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=pòguā
|cat=v
}}

===Verb===
{{zh-verb}}

# {{lb|zh|literary|of a girl}} to [[reach]] the [[age]] of 16
# {{lb|zh|literary|figurative|of a girl}} to [[lose]] one's [[virginity]]
# {{lb|zh|literary|of a man}} to [[reach]] the [[age]] of 64
